bow: question about weird thing that happened at school yesterday my daughters school called and said she didn show up to pe after they left music they found her at her desk with her head down sleeping couldn get her to open her eyes or talk to anyone she would flinch away if you punched or tickled her would stand grab for stuff etc well get there and take her to the er few minutes after we get to the er she opens her eyes starts talking is completely fine neuro check was fine so they didn do scan don think anything medical is going on the doctor seems to think either she fell asleep was embarrassed so she acted like she was still sleeping got super embarrassed and didn know how to get out of said situation when people started to get worried or she wanted to get out of school and is pretty smart for year old asked her if anything is bothering her at school or if anyone is being mean or anything and asked her if anything is bothering her at home and she says no she has tic where she blinks frequently and her teacher called me yesterday and said it has been worse at school the last week or so took her to her regular doctor today her doctor is not concerned and also thinks she was just faking it she also asked all kinds of questions about school as well as doing neuro exam and said that all seems fine suggested that maybe try low dose of melatonin and see if that improves her tic at all suggesting maybe she just tired am completely satisfied by these answers however had missed the original school call immediately called back but the next person on the list to call was my mom so by the time got to the school she was also there in complete hysterics because she makes everything crazy and she convinced that something is medically going on so guess just asking if anyone has had any similar situations she acted completely fine since the incident by the way no concerning behaviors at all would have frank conversation with your child let her know that you re worried about her and that she not in trouble if she wasn telling the truth about sleeping before and that you ll believe what she says now either way but that you need to know 100 what happened because it could be really serious if she says she was lying that she was sleeping and pretending thank her for telling the truth and hat you hope next time she ll be truthful sooner but do not get her in trouble or she won tell you next time depending on her answer start getting second opinions and seeing other doctors who will take what happened seriously as for the tic becoming more frequent ask the teacher to start recording when and for how long it happening at school we can sometimes think pattern happened when it didn because it makes sense at the time having record of when and how long these tics are happening gives baseline or at least important information to medical professional my experience in life says nothing is going on sometimes bodies are weird and sometimes kids are weird my experience on reddit says that doctor google will soon inform you that this is super rare albeit not harmful genetic trait that your third uncle passed down and can be treated with something like aspirin haha could it be one of those seizures where they just completely zone out ve forgotten what they are called seems odd to me be investigating bit more for sure don let the drs just ride it off as cheeky behaviour read something where mother and doctors discovered her child was severely sleep deprived the child did sleep study and was getting zero rem sleep and only 85 oxygen at night they removed tonsil and adenoids and treated for sleep apnea if there is sleep issue maybe sleep study could provide answers anecdotal know but my mother used to fall asleep at her desk at school turned out she was super anemic had have troubles with being overtired myself due to being hypothyroid if no blood tests were run for anemia or anything else that could cause extreme tiredness personally would push for some but that would in part be because of my family history not sure about everything else but for the tic developed tic before it was realized that needed glasses blinked incessantly did her pedi check her eyesight also know little to nothing on the topic but after working with an optometrist who suggested pandas diagnosis after blinking tic appeared in grade school child your situation sounds similar look up the symptoms there lot and she does have to have them all and see if it sounds plausible if so maybe it worth another opinion from different doctor if were in your shoes probably start keeping some detailed notes about things like this just to ease my own mind or to have something to bring to an appointment with me could it have been low blood sugar episode my daughter has had few in her life not diabetic and she was hard to rouse but was responsive to painful stimuli she would be able to stand up for short periods of time but was really really sleepy after got her to eat she immediately perked back up la paul blart mall cop after the sucker just an idea yeah did no one question an absence seizure sorry this happened hope she ok just wanted to add since you mentioned melatonin people have different reactions to it took it and it kept me up was sleepy but could not for the life of me actually fall asleep it was awful my husband took it and it gave him bad nights sleep too think it made one or both of us very sleepy the next day so you may want to hold off on trying it until the other issues are resolved that way you re not adding another component the thing that find concerning are the tics and blinking what makes the doctor think she is faking look into testing for absence seizures they can be really odd and easily dismissed as spacing out or being weird absence seizures usually last less than 15 seconds it extremely rare for them to last longer than that sure but to dismiss without basic workup seems poor had blink tic when was younger still fight against it to this day it comes out when extremely stressed or super anxious never wanted medication for my anxiety just willed myself to catch it before it got bad but maybe she stressing over something at school mean who isn but sometimes it comes out as pretty annoying tic look for other signs like biting nails or the inside of her lip did other little things like touching my thumb to each fingertip without realizing was doing it all signs of anxiety for me anyway no professional just sharing my experience had nephew develop frequent tics blinking we worried it was tourettes syndrome but doctor diagnosed him with seasonal allergies and the blinking stopped with his allergy meds has your daughter had recent vision assessment could also be she is straining her eyes and needs glasses also there can be many adhd symptoms if the child breathes through their mouth and not the nose they can be deprived of oxygen absolutely wouldn let the matter drop until after following up with neurologist used to do the same thing was having absence seizures and severe migraines it took neurologists before was diagnosed and put on meds please do give up yet watch her carefully and trust your gut good luck seriously dislike the blame the child approach here this is abnormal behavior with potentially serious causes there seem to be neurological issues that an er visit neuro exam might not catch try to get video of the tics and search for answers if they are right she fine if something is going on you believed her and time is on your side if you move quickly have serious talk with her and ask her questions with the preface that she in no way in trouble but you re worried maybe she not getting enough sleep maybe it something more serious trust your gut god
